summary: This is an email chain from July 6, 2020, between U.S. Pretrial Services and an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) regarding the intake and upcoming legal proceedings for defendant Ghislaine Maxwell. It includes details about her arrival, housing, charges, and coordination with her defense counsel for her arraignment and bail hearing.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, charged with conspiracy to entice minors to travel to engage in illegal sex acts, transportation of a minor, and perjury. She is being held at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) pending arraignment and a bail hearing.

persons.name: Chris Everdell
persons.context: Listed as one of Ghislaine Maxwell's retained defense attorneys in the pretrial services intake form.

persons.name: Mark Cohen
persons.context: Listed as one of Ghislaine Maxwell's retained defense attorneys in the pretrial services intake form.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge before whom Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment and bail hearing are scheduled to take place.

connections.description: Chris Everdell is listed as retained defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell in the pretrial services document.
Mark Cohen is listed as retained defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell in the pretrial services document.
Both are listed as defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell, indicating they are working together on her defense team.

events.title: Maxwell's Arraignment and Bail Hearing
events.description: Scheduled arraignment and bail hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell before Judge Nathan.

events.title: Maxwell's Arrival in SDNY
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell arrived in the Southern District of New York and was expected to be housed at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

events.title: Filing of Indictment and Detention Motion
events.description: The indictment and the Government's motion for detention against Ghislaine Maxwell were filed.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was charged with conspiracy to entice minors to travel to engage in illegal sex acts, transportation of a minor with intent to engage in illegal sex acts, and perjury.
Maxwell was in custody at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) following her arrival in the Southern District of New York around July 6, 2020.
Her arraignment and bail hearing were scheduled for July 10, 2020, before Judge Nathan.
She was represented by retained defense attorneys Chris Everdell and Mark Cohen.
The email chain shows coordination between U.S. Pretrial Services, the prosecution (AUSA), and defense counsel regarding her intake and upcoming court proceedings.
